responses.content: It's about the product lineup. iPhone 17 Pro is the most pro phone ever, iPhone Air is incredibly thin and light, and the base iPhone 17 brings pro features to the consumer lineup. It's the strongest lineup ever.

China is vibrant and dynamic. Store traffic is up significantly. iPhone 17 family is well received. We expect to return to growth in Q1. Subsidies play a favorable role but only apply to certain price ranges.

We ended the quarter at the low end of targeted channel inventory due to constraints on iPhone 16 and 17 models. We are currently constrained on several iPhone 17 models due to very strong demand, not manufacturing issues.
Tariff impact goes from $1.1 billion in Q4 to a projected $1.4 billion in Q1. This assumes a stable environment and factors in the recent rate change from 20% to 10% in China.

We are creating Apple Foundation Models, shipping them on-device and in Private Cloud Compute. We are open to M&A. AI is a factor in purchasing decisions, and we are bullish on it becoming a greater factor.

Q4 gross margin was 47.2%, driven by favorable mix. Guidance for Q1 is 47-48%. Sequential increase driven by favorable mix, particularly on the product side, despite higher cost structures of new products.
Services growth of 15% was organic and broad-based across categories and geographies. No one specific factor drove the outperformance. Majority of categories saw sequential acceleration.

OpEx increase is driven by R&D investments in AI and product roadmap. We manage for the long term. Gross margin expansion allows for healthy operating leverage despite OpEx growing faster than revenue.
We are increasing CapEx for AI, including building out Private Cloud Compute in first-party data centers. We continue to leverage a hybrid model with third-party capacity.

questions: Is iPhone 17 success due to the replacement cycle or specific features?
How are you managing component cost inflation, particularly memory?
How will iPhone trend in China in the December quarter? Have you turned the corner?
Was Services upside driven by organic performance or one-time factors like antitrust rulings?
What drove the acceleration in Services revenue? Was it cross-selling or installed base growth?
Are there shifts between upgraders and switchers? How is channel inventory?
What are the puts and takes for the December quarter gross margin guidance?
What drove the weakness in China in the September quarter?
Do you expect to exit the December quarter without supply constraints?
How do you view the sustainability of Services growth given concerns about search volumes decelerating due to AI?
What role are smartphone subsidies playing in China momentum?
Can you dig into the sizable OpEx step-up and is this the new normal?
How does the tariff impact increase to $1.4B relate to the sequential revenue uplift?
Is there an opportunity for Mac upside from attach rates despite the tough comp?
Can you quantify how much business was lost due to constraints?
Will AI-infused web services change mobile app ecosystem behavior and impact the App Store?
Is there a change in mix towards Pro models for iPhone 17?
How should we think about the build-out of Private Cloud Compute?
Does iPhone Air reception give insight into the foldable market?
Will you continue the three-pronged AI strategy (own models, partners, M&A)?
Is AI a material purchase consideration for consumers?
Will Apple alter its hybrid data center approach given scarcity and increased CapEx?
